H0.text: Air is the type of pollution most often associated with burning fossil fuels, which are common sources of energy.

H1.text: Land is the type of pollution most often associated with burning fossil fuels, which are common sources of energy.

H2.text: Noise is the type of pollution most often associated with burning fossil fuels, which are common sources of energy.

H3.text: Water pollution is most often associated with burning fossil fuels, which are common sources of energy.

A4.text: The burning of fossil fuels is the largest source of air pollution deaths.

A5.text: NO and NO2 can form acid rain, can form into a haze, and can cause nutrient pollution in water.

A6.text: In 2013 the burning of fossil fuels produced around 32 billion tonnes (32 gigatonnes) of carbon dioxide and additional air pollution.
